result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L. Coolidge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CLERKS NOTE: In checking with the Judge, the Judge advised to cancel the bond forfeiture procedure
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 8:14am [mo]
Defendant Thomas L. Coolidge in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Huebner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2 and #3

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5 months in Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--15 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $50 drug testing fee=$493.00, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 4/8/2016 and on the 8th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
--The Court orders suspension of Mr. Coolidge's operating privileges for 1 year; this is to be consecutive to any other suspension in being 

recess:8:32am
Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 1:35pm. 
Defendant Thomas L. Coolidge appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (it is noted that Attorney Huebner is PD appointed counsel for Mr. Coolidge; Attorney Hagemann appears today for bond purposes).   Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments given on Bond 
The Court requires a $500 Cash bond.
recess 1:33pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference 11/24/15 at 8:30am  (Defendant is in JCJ on a PO Hold)

Case called at 9:44am [mo]
Defendant Thomas L. Coolidge does not appear in court.
 Attorney Karl Huebner appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court reviews the Court Record, including Notice of Hearings.

Atty. Huebner indicates that he has not had recent contact with Mr. Coolidge.
ADA Shock requests a bench warrant.
On Motion of the State, the Court issues a bench warrant, finds bond to be in default and orders the bond forfeit.
recess: 9:48am

[MK] case called at 3:05pm. 
Defendant Thomas L. Coolidge in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner acknowledges awareness of the Court's disclosure made at the Initial Appearance. The Court indicates that the Conflict Review Worksheet is available in the court file for review.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense
recess 3:07pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/26/15 at 10:00am  (2)  Status Conference on 9/8/15 at 9:00am
Conflict Review Worksheet - No conflict found
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:52 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Thomas L. Coolidge in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; Court reviews conflict review worksheet; Finds no conflict or need to recuse or disqualify and endorses order; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 & #2
Mr. Coolidge informs the Court that he has counsel, Monica Wallbusch, but she can not appear today - confirms he heard the Court's ealier recitation of right to counsel & constructive waiver of counsel warning given

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with no special conditions: 
Recess: 3:03 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 7/21/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices *Defendant will be late - maybe 2:30 pm - ok by Court*
